alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 7:53AM CDT until April 01 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Crooked River near Richmond affecting Ray County. Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County. For the Crooked River...including Richmond...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wakenda Creek...including Carrollton...Minor flooding is forecast. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 16.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Thu 1pm 1am 1pm Wakenda Creek Carrollton 16.0 10.1 Wed 7am 13.6 16.0 16.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
